events.name: A confident speaker: a proven communications programme (open to public)
events.description:
A proven platform for members to learn to speak to their colleagues, their clients and superiors with ease, confidence and impact. 
  
Guests are welcome to join our meetings at no cost, and to experience the below tried and proven activities that has benefited our members for the past 90 years: 
1) Speeches by members 
This is the time for members to improve their communication skills before an audience. Members are encouraged to speak and not afraid of making "mistakes", as this is a place where all learn while having fun. In this way, our members will be able to raise their standards as a confident speaker, step by step, at their own comfortable pace. 
  
2) Evaluate to motivate 
Experienced toastmasters will give feedback to the speakers. They will highlight their strengths, as well as their areas of improvements. This segment is to motivate the speakers to perform better in their future speeches. 
  
3) Special workshop 
Speaker: Crispin Rodrigues, DTM 
Besides being a university lecturer, Crispin is also a poet, actor, playwright and emcee. He also displayed his talents in his writing skills as the editor-in-chief at "The Eloquent Orifice", a Singapore based literary and cultural e-magazine. On top of his commitments, he volunteered his time by taking on a senior volunteer leader, overseeing over 20 Toastmasters clubs. 
  
Dress code: Office attire or casual wear (No shorts or slippers)
events.location: Oo La Laa Cafe and Bistro, 2 Marne Rd, Singapore 208393

events.name: Pre-Hackathon Workshop, Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
The Pre-Hackathon Workshop is a great opportunity for you to get a headstart for the Manpower Hackathon and immerse yourself in the themes with help from subject-matter experts.   
Learn from individuals working closely with local and foreign workers about the issues they face.  Use this to find out how your solutions can help empower these workers, making them aware of employment laws. Similarly, get an in-depth understanding of the opportunities available for technology-enabled tools to help instil the importance of WSH and design the Next Generation Work Pass.   
Insights into the themes will come in handy when building your solutions during the hackathon weekend!   
  
PROGRAMME HIGHLIGHTS 
• Introduction to themes by MOM representatives  
• Case study: Foreign Worker engagement through mobile / SMS - Anurag Banerjee, Board Member, Ozonetel 
• Case study: Next Generation Work Pass – e.g. Smart Card  – Jimmy Ang, Marketing Director for Government Programs, Asia Pacific in Gemalto 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Tuesday, 3 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
  
MORE INFORMATION 
Find out more about the Manpower Hackathon and workshop here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: Singapore SharePoint Community Meeting - February 2015
events.description:
Hi All, 
Returning back from our long holiday break we are kicking off the year with a presentation from a Microsoft Developer tools Technical Evangelist discussing ALM in SharePoint 
  
Chee Yong 
Developer tools Technical Evangelist 
ALM for SharePoint 2013 
In this session Chee Yong will discuss Application Lifecycle Management using Team Foundation Server and Visual Studio for SharePoint. 
  
Regards, 
Milan
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, 1 Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Singapore City 018989
